title: What are the things we should do while making an original song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hum anything, for like 10mins nonstop, it doesnt have to be right/ wrong, just go with the flow, and try to improvise that melody/ies , over your fav instrument, repeat this process, take short break, repeat again, select the best parts, write the drum/ rythm parts, try to craft in a genre that suits the vibe of your song, write lyrics, or use old lyrics that you have written, improvise, polish, just create , it doesnt have to be perfect, ask opinions of experts , they will guide your song to more light. for eg. i had this great lyrical example, but i couldnt expand, but the melody was great , so i thought , i should make an instrumental first so that , my lines will be forced according to the framework of the song , and this resulted me to produce an awesome instrumentation, check this out this is the exact one

I have a suggestion which rings very true for me. What ever you are writing, write the lyrics and notes for your to remember the tune and melody. This is from the voice of experience. From years ago, I wrote many songs and jazz tunes. My memory was excellent and I could remember songs I had written years ago… I had all the songs at my finger tips at a moments notice. In late 2008, I began having difficulty in remembering the tunes, and by December 2008 I had forgotten all of them. I even lost my ability to play guitar which I learned to play well in 1962 as a kid. I was diagnosed with a 7 inch diameter brain tumor which took 3 surgeries to remove and halt any further paralysis. Like an idiot, I never wrote any thing down… I thought I knew it all…. obviously I didn’t! When you write a tune, keep a notebook and if able record it on some type of recording device… Voice of experience.
